title: Sprytix - Agile Insights
text:
I offer a partnership with your organization to assess your current processes, identify bottlenecks, and design tailored Agile strategies. My expertise comes to light in providing actionable insights and hands-on guidance to help you streamline workflows, enhance collaboration, and achieve measurable results.





My goal is to empower your teams with the knowledge and skills to thrive in an Agile environment. My customized training programs cover Agile frameworks, tools, and best practices, equipping your workforce to deliver value faster and adapt to changing business needs.





Agility is about continuous improvement. I intend to help you embed a culture of adaptability by refining your processes, optimizing metrics, and fostering innovation. Whether scaling Agile across teams or evolving your strategy, I will ensure your organization stays agile in a dynamic market.

title: About
text:
I am a true Agilist, who strongly believes in delivering value with an Agile mindset. After spending over a decade in project management, I have worked with various teams and applied Agile methodologies such as Scrum, Kanban, SAFe and XP.
With a total of 20+ years of work experience, I have exposure to working in various domains such as Insurance, Transportation, Healthcare, Manufacturing and Retail. I hold a Post Graduate Diploma in IT and a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science.
When not innovating, I enjoy spending time in watching soccer and playing with my furball, Hope.

title: Mission
text:
As an Agilist, the journey of deriving and presenting Agile metrics using tools like JIRA, Slack, and Monday.com is both rewarding and fraught with challenges. These tools offer powerful capabilities to track velocity, cycle time, burndown charts, and more, but the real art lies in ensuring these metrics tell a meaningful story. We must navigate the pitfalls of data overload, resistance from teams wary of micromanagement, and the constant balancing act between quantitative metrics and qualitative insights.
Is there ever an easier way to derive and present these Agile metrics? Sprytix is an attempt to solve the paradox of standardizing these metrics and enable us to give meaning to these numbers. Please feel free to reach out to me for deriving Agile insights from project raw data.

title: Insights
text:
Every Agile project is creating data points. One of the favourite tools used by Agile practitioners is Excel. Often, templates are imported into Excel to map with existing data and benchmark progress using metrics. This process gets cumbersome to manage over time.
Here are some of the standard Agile metrics that can be realized effortlessly:

Agile Metrics







Flavour
Metric
Description




Scrum
Sprint Burndown Chart

Tracks remaining work in a sprint against the sprint timeline.
Helps teams monitor progress and adjust if they are falling behind



Scrum
Velocity

Measures the average amount of work (story points) completed in a sprint.
Useful for sprint planning and predicting future performance



Kanban, SAFe
Lead Time

Measures the time taken from task initiation to completion.
Indicates process efficiency and helps identify bottlenecks



Kanban, SAFe
Cycle Time

Tracks the time taken to complete a task once it starts.
Helps teams optimize workflow and reduce delays



Kanban, SAFe
Cumulative Flow Diagram

Visualizes the number of tasks in each workflow state over time.
Used to identify bottlenecks and ensure smooth task flow



Kanban, SAFe
Work In Progress (WIP) limits

Monitors the number of tasks being worked on simultaneously.
Helps maintain focus and avoid overloading teams



Kanban, SAFe
Throughput

Measures the number of tasks completed in a given timeframe.
Reflects team capacity and productivity trends



Scrum, SAFe
Escaped Defects

Tracks defects that make it to production.
Indicates quality issues and areas needing improvement in testing or development processes



Scrum, Kanban, SAFe
Team Happiness or Morale

Measures team satisfaction through surveys or feedback.
Provides insights into team dynamics and potential burnout risks



SAFe
Predictability or Program Increment Objectives Met

Assesses how well teams meet their planned objectives during a Program Increment.
Enhances alignment between team goals and business outcomess
